      • getGraph

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.Set<java.lang.String>> getGraph()

      • getNearestPositionPairFromPathPoint

        public gov.nasa.worldwind.geom.Position[] getNearestPositionPairFromPathPoint(PathExtArea path,
                                                                     gov.nasa.worldwind.geom.Position pos)
        Finds the two positions identifying the segment of the path clicked by the user. Whenever a user click on a path we get the click position and the path clicked. A path can contain more segments. In order to retrieve the right segment the method iterates over all the segments and find the more likely clicked one. Every segment is divided in small parts. Then the part which yields the smaller distance from the clicked point will be owned by the clicked segment.
        Parameters:
        path -
        pos -
        Returns:
        the position of the clicked segment

      • getNextNodeForDestination

        public java.util.List<gov.nasa.worldwind.geom.Position> getNextNodeForDestination(gov.nasa.worldwind.geom.Position pos,
                                                                         gov.nasa.worldwind.geom.Position dest)
        Computes the best path between position pos and dest using segments weights
        Parameters:
        pos -
        dest -
        Returns:
        the list of positions of the best path. Returs null if the path does not exist

      • setCarSpeed

        public void setCarSpeed(Car car,
               gov.nasa.worldwind.geom.Position p1,
               gov.nasa.worldwind.geom.Position p2)
        Selects the right speed of a car moving in the segment identified by positions p1 and p2. The queue of cars in the segment is retrieved. If a faster car has a number of cars in front of it greater than the passable cars number, the faster car slows down in the moment it is approaching the first slower car. Otherwise the car speed is not changed. When a slowed car is not constrained, it reaches back its original speed.
        Parameters:
        car -
        p1 -
        p2 -

      • setDangerAreasIncluded

        public void setDangerAreasIncluded(boolean dangerAreasIncluded)

      • totalCarsInPath

        public int[] totalCarsInPath(PathExtArea path)
        Computes the number of cars in a path.
        Parameters:
        path -
        Returns:
        ret[0] cars in the normal way, ret[1] cars in the opposite way, ret[2] total number of cars

      • totalCountedCarsInPath

        public void updateGraph(gov.nasa.worldwind.geom.Position position1,
               gov.nasa.worldwind.geom.Position position2,

      • updateSegments

        public void updateSegments(Car car,
                  gov.nasa.worldwind.geom.Position p1,
                  gov.nasa.worldwind.geom.Position p2,
                  gov.nasa.worldwind.geom.Position p3)
        Updates the information related to a segment, namely information about the cars in it. The car is in position p2, it is going towards position p3 and it was coming from position p1. This means that it is exiting from the segment identified by the position pair (p1, p2) and entering the segment (p2, p3).
        Parameters:
        car -
        p1 - car origin
        p2 - car position
        p3 - car next destination
